body:
Comment 14 by **holmesjack234**: 
I still had gofmt, as well as other go things, from a previous version.  I
had deleted to go tree before installing go 1, but forgot to get the old go
commands in my own bin.  Sorry to waste your time on this silly error.

I did rename the gofmt on my bin, and the go fmt command work correctly
now.  I will now delete them from my bin and move my bin to later in my
path.

john-holmes-imac:~ johnholmes$ which gofmt
/Users/johnholmes/bin/gofmt
john-holmes-imac:~ johnholmes$ cd
john-holmes-imac:~ johnholmes$ cd bin
john-holmes-imac:bin johnholmes$ ls
6a cgo godoc gopprof rdwds
6c ebnflint gofmt gotest
6g edwds goinstall goyacc
6l gocomp gomake hgpatch
6nm godefs gopack quietgcc
john-holmes-imac:bin johnholmes$ mv gofmt gofmt1
john-holmes-imac:bin johnholmes$ which gofmt
/usr/local/go/bin/gofmt
john-holmes-imac:bin johnholmes$ cd
john-holmes-imac:~ johnholmes$ cd Documents/source/go
john-holmes-imac:go johnholmes$ ls
6.out exp hello.go progs
echo.go exp2 hello.go~ snup
example garp.zip hello1.go snup.go
examples hello hello1.go~ tmp
john-holmes-imac:go johnholmes$ go fmt hello.go
hello.go
john-holmes-imac:go johnholmes$ gofmt hello.go
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {

var ar = [5]int{5, 7, 12, 4, 6}
var far = [5]float64{5.1, 7.0, 12.2, 4.9, 6.6}
// type interface sum()
fmt.Printf("hello, world\n, %d, %f\n", ar[3], far[2])
}
john-holmes-imac:go johnholmes$ whereis gofmt
john-holmes-imac:go johnholmes$ which gotfmt
john-holmes-imac:go johnholmes$ which gofmt
/usr/local/go/bin/gofmt



Thanks for your time.  I'm am glad to see this solved.

Jack Holmes
